basics.name: Ievgen Borovenskyi
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am pursuing a B.A. in Computer Science and Biochemistry at Bowdoin College and I'm expected to graduate in May 2027. I plan to continue into a Ph.D. in Human Genetics, aiming for ABMGG certification as a Clinical Biochemical Laboratory Geneticist.

courses: CSCI 2102 - Data Structures Advanced Programming II (B)

education.institution: Veterans Tribute Career and Technical Academy (VTCTA)

work.summary: Conducted computational and theoretical chemistry research on azirines (Az-Me) to explore covalent probe design.
highlights: Modeled nucleophilic attack mechanisms using Density Functional Theory (DFT)
Applied Nudged Elastic Band (NEB) and coordinate scans to locate transition states
Collaborated with Seebald Group (Haverford College) to validate computational predictions with experimental mass spectrometry
Analyzed reaction pathways, energy barriers, and mechanistic differences across nucleophiles

work.summary: Conducted computational research and analysis on population genomics of parrotfish.
highlights: Analyzed 81 parrotfish samples via VCF files
Applied SVDquartets, ASTRAL, and CASTER for species tree inference
Developed frameworks for comparative evaluation of phylogenetic software

work.summary: Provided lifeguard services including CPR, resuscitation, and first aid response in a high-volume public environment.
highlights: Trained in emergency medical response (CPR, resuscitation, first aid)
Developed strong situational awareness and crisis management skills
Contributed financially to support family in Ukraine

work.summary: Performed diverse handyman services including construction, repair, and maintenance.
highlights: Plastering, plumbing, painting, and electrical support
Air conditioning maintenance and general cleaning

volunteer.summary: Volunteered as an EMT providing medical support and emergency response.
highlights: Responded to medical emergencies
Gained hands-on patient care experience in pre-hospital settings

volunteer.summary: Organized and distributed masks during the pandemic.
highlights: Created and distributed 10,000+ masks to community members and gymnasts

volunteer.summary: Supported foreign community of fellow Ukrainians through the process of finding and signing relocation documents for immigration.
highlights: Connected Multiple Ukrainian Families With Host Families

volunteer.summary: Provided gymnastics and acrobatics coaching to youth athletes.
highlights: 700+ hours coaching
Mentored athletes in gymnastics and acrobatics

projects.name: Quantum Chemistry Research on Az-Me
projects.summary: Investigated reactivity of azirine model compound (Az-Me) for covalent probe design using DFT.
highlights: Modeled ethanol, ethanethiol, and acetic acid nucleophiles with Density Functional Theory
Identified transition states using Nudged Elastic Band (NEB) and reaction scans
Compared asynchronous vs. concerted bond formation pathways
Collaborated with Seebald Group (Haverford College) to validate computational predictions with experimental mass spectrometry

projects.name: Independent Research — Carlon Lab, Bowdoin College
projects.summary: Studied population structure of Pacific parrotfish using computational phylogenetic methods.
highlights: Analyzed 81 parrotfish samples via VCF files
Applied PAUP+ (SVDquartets), ASTRAL, and CASTER for species tree inference
Evaluated trade-offs in accuracy, runtime, and usability across programs
Advanced understanding of parrotfish divergence and population structure

extracurricular.name: Emergency Medical Technician Club At Bowdoin College
extracurricular.summary: Engaged in civic community ambulance programming.

extracurricular.name: HOSA (Health Occupations Students of America)
extracurricular.summary: Joined to expand knowledge of medicine and support EMS program.

awards.title: QuestBridge National College Match — Full Ride Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded a full-ride scholarship to Bowdoin College.

awards.title: Kufe Family Research Fellowship
awards.summary: Sponsored grant awarded to pursue further research in the summer full time in Computational Quntum Chemistry by expanding on an independent study.

awards.title: Gymnastics Coach of the Year
awards.summary: For excellence in youth gymnastics coaching
